channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #115
item.content:encoded:
#115 - apr 19th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Andre do Amaral
Designer website with great portfolio

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
30 CSS Page Preload Animations
The animations are very easy to customize since they are made out of just CSS.
Ghostlab
Debug CSS and Javascript cross multiple devices.
Trianglify Generator
Beautiful background generator.
Pay me or else
(book) free book about how to avoid and deal with clients that don't pay.
Lastbackend
Visual interface to create stacks and deployments.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.2.2 Released apr 13
This release includes the security fix for a OpenSSL extensionâ€™s hostname verification vulnerability.
Layzr.js
Dependency-free library for lazy loading images.
Pair up
Allows two developers to be jointly credited when Pair Programming.
Git LFS
An open source Git extension for versioning large files.
Smolder
Simple rest smoke tests.
RancherVM
Package and Run Virtual Machines as Docker Containers.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
A Visual Guide to CSS3 Flexbox Properties apr 13
How the flex properties affect the layout in a visual way.
Unexpected: The New Minitest::Spec Syntax apr 14
A lot of of developers got started with Minitest during the past few years because of Minitest::Spec.
More Control over Text Decoration apr 14
text-decoration properties and various sub-properties for more fine-grained control.
Protecting infrastructure secrets with Keywhiz apr 14
This is a project by Square, for distributed secrets management.
Exploring new methods in Ruby 2.2.0 apr 15
Ruby 2.2.0 introduced couple of new methods to the Enumerable module, Float, File and String classes.
Class methods and singleton methods apr 15
Some trick for dealing with singleton methods and inheritance.
Cut and Copy Commands apr 15
IE10+ and Chrome 43+ now support cut and copy commands.
Introduction to inuitcss: A Different Kind of CSS Framework apr 15
Instead of including a bunch of modules that we will never use, inuitCSS lets us piece together our own architecture.
RethinkDB in Ruby: Map Reduce and Joins apr 16
Take a look at some of the features in RethinkDB.
Thinking Outside the DOM: Composed Validators and Data Collection apr 16
Validate several parts of the email address separately and provide a targeted email validation error.
Responsive Data Tables apr 16
Tables that can scale well in different viewport sizes.
Sass Theming with Configuration Files apr 16
Managing multiple websites based on the same CSS codebase.
Savon - SOAP that doesn't leave you feeling dirty apr 17
Quick intor on how to soap in ruby.
HTML vs Body in CSS apr 17
The difference between and is easy to overlook.
A QUIC update on Googleâ€™s experimental transport apr 17
Google Wants To Speed Up The Web With Its QUIC Protocol.
Open-source log monitoring tools on Linux apr 17
Review of 25 tools you can use on linux for monitoring.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
How To Write 'Macros' in Ruby (15m) apr 14
Recreate a simplified version of the has_many declaration from scratch.
Gorails 51 (13m) apr 17
Add PDF receipts to your application.

item.title: Green Ruby News #114
item.content:encoded:
#114 - apr 12th 2015

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby bookmarks
Ruby and Ruby on Rails bookmarks collection.
Pexels videos
Completely free stock videos.
Git Style Guide
Git Style Guide inspired by the Linux Kernel guidelines and various popular practices.
waitMe
Generator for content loading animations.
The path to performance
A podcast for everyone dedicated to making websites faster.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Isabella
A voice-computing assistant built in Ruby.
garfio
A small yet neat lib for adding callbacks to methods.
Eldr
Eldr is a ruby framework without all the magic.
Space.js
HTML-driven narrative 3D-scrolling.
hubrelease
Generate release notes from closed issues and merged pull requests.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
How to Debug Ruby Performance Problems in Production apr 6
Use rbtrace like strace and debug your ruby/rails code.
Template Method Pattern in Ruby apr 6
Implement template method pattern in ruby.
How to build a parser with Ruby apr 7
Build a parser by ruby StringScanner class.
Rubyâ€™s Partition for Enumerables apr 8
Less known Enum method which splits collection to 2 by match/unmatch condition.
Ruby Metaprogramming - Method Missing apr 8
Use method_missing in meta-programming.
How to Code HTML Email Newsletters apr 8
The task of creating an HTML email that will display consistently appears both simple and horribly complex.
How to Create a Chrome Extension in 10 Minutes Flat apr 8
Creating a Chrome extension is easier than you may think.
Why is Rubygems slow? apr 9
A deep walk through of how Rubygems works.
WebSockets in Rails 4 apr 9
Implement websockets by concurrency and rack hijack.
Add a Timeline to Your Website with Google Charts apr 9
how to use Google Charts to add professional looking timelines to your web pages.
Build a Node.js-powered Chatroom Web App: Connecting with WebSockets apr 9
This Node.js tutorial series will help you build a real-time chatroom web app fully deployed in the cloud.
Accelerate Your JavaScript Development with CoffeeScript apr 10
For people out there that still don't know what it does.
3D Bold Navigation apr 10
A bold navigation that slides in when active, replacing the current content in a 3D space.
Introduction to R and RStudio apr 11
R is a language built solely for statistical computing.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Sysadmincast 48 (13m) apr 9
Static Sites using AWS S3, CloudFront, and Route 53
BathRuby 2015 (8 videos) apr 10
All talks in BathRuby Conference 2015

item.title: Green Ruby News #113
item.content:encoded:
#113 - apr 5th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Bindfilm
It's all in dutch but the visual work speaks for itself.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rails Play
A playground to experiment with Rails quickly and easily.
Ruby Performance Optimization
(book) beta release.
Primer
The CSS toolkit and guidelines that power GitHub.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Crystal
A compiled language with a Ruby-flavored syntax.
Eldr
A minimal Ruby framework only on top of rack.
ToNil
Cast everything to nil.
Irb tgools
Improvements for ruby irb.
Citadel
Toolkit for scheduling containers on a Docker cluster.
FnordMetric
Write SQL queries that return SVG charts rather than tables.
shpec
Test your shell scripts.
React Native
A framewwork for building native apps using react.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
On Ruby mar 30
Gain code confidence by select good libraries
Rails 4 Awesome enums mar 31
Introducing Rails 4 enum method
Know Ruby: Enumerable grep apr 1
Another convenient method for fetching elements in collection.
Ways to Optimize Jenkins apr 1
Seven ways to make sure you use Jenkins efficiently.
Ruby Metaprogramming - Creating Methods apr 2
Use metaprogramming to avoid writing repetitive code.
The Rise of Unikernels apr 2
How Unikernels Deliver Better Security.
Starting a Refactor with CSS Dig apr 3
CSS dig is an open source Chrome Extension for analyzing CSS.
Testing react component with jest apr 3
Jest makes a bold claim to be 'Painless Javascript Unit Testing'.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Gorails 49 (19m) apr 4
Newsletter Sign Up Form with country_select

item.title: Green Ruby News #112
item.content:encoded:
#112 - mar 29th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Plastibionic
Website of a design studio. The pull-to-load at the bottom is quite clever.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Crono
A time-based background job scheduler daemon for Rails.
DeviceDetector
Fast user agent parser with an extensive database.
Attestor
Validations and policies for immutable Ruby objects.
Variables
Variable objects for class and instance variables.
Artoo
Robotics framework in Ruby with support for 15 different platforms.
Circulus.svg
Circular menu generator, that lets you generate an SVG menu.
PageSpeed Insights
Sites with faster performance do better in search results.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Upcoming changes in Rails 5.0 mar 23
Changes that are confirmed to be in the new version.
Only Grab the Files You Need While Using Bower mar 23
Bower brings some sanity to the multitudes of frontend packages that can be used in your application.
Aesthetic Sass 1: Architecture and Style Organization mar 24
Improve the organization of both stylesheet files and styles within these stylesheets.
Playing with Constants, Methods, and Superclasses mar 24
Did you know that you can have a constant and a method with the exact same name, and they wonâ€™t collide?
Toolkit: A Front-End Framework for the Modern Web mar 24
Front-end framework that provides a collection of user interface components and utility classes.
I like to keep my Promises mar 25
Why and how to use promises in Javascript.
Building a Custom Right-Click (Context) Menu with JavaScript mar 25
A menu that appears upon user interaction, such as a right-click mouse operation.
Numeric Inputs â€“ A Comparison of Browser Defaults mar 25
How browsers handles input with type number.
Choose a Random Option based on a Range mar 26
Random, but not equally random.
Different Collection Types in Ruby mar 26
Most known to least known collection types in Ruby.
A template engine in less than 30 lines of code mar 26
Template engines are really simple once you look inside.
Devise Authentication in Depth mar 26
Second article in a Devise series, which dives into authentication customization.
Performance Issue Considerations for Microservices APIs mar 26
When architecture slides to microservices, logging and monitoring require a new kind of attention.
Why Baidu was hijacked to attack GitHub mar 27
Explanation of the Github DDoS incident of the week.
Toward a Better Markdown Tutorial mar 28
It is surprising when technical people say they don't know Markdown.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
MountainWest JavaScript 2015 (15 videos) mar 27
It happened in early march, confreaks just uploaded the videos.

item.title: Green Ruby News #111
item.content:encoded:
#111 - mar 22th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
1000 Chrome experiments
Better get there with a webGL-enabled browser like, hmm, chrome (but works on firefox too).
White Frontier Brewery
Neat design for Beer lovers.
Species in pieces
A css-based exposition.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
AniCollection
Animations from many libraries and many people all in one place.
Hackr.io
Share and discover the best programming tutorials online.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.2.1 and 4.1.10
Fresh new versions, announced at the end of the week.
Saddler
Integrate any lint, security checker and tools with anywhere (e.g. GitHub Pull Request Review Comment).
Textures.js
SVG patterns for Data Visualization.
Sanitize.css
Render elements consistently. Style with best practices.
Reapp
Build mobile apps with React and JavaScript.
Type.js
New CSS properties to take finer typographic control of type styles on the web.
Logdown
Debug utility with markdown support that runs on browser and server.
ES stats
ElasticSearch cluster metrics to Graphite.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Reading Rails - Time Travel mar 15
In Rails 4.1, travel and travel_to helpers were introduced.
How Does Symbol#to_proc Work? mar 16
One of the finest examples of the flexibility and beauty of Ruby.
Internationalization of AngularJS Applications mar 16
Using Yeoman AngularJS generator, asynchronous translate.
Strategies for Staying on Top of Web Performance mar 16
Various tricks to put performance on the first line.
How to Get Started with learning ES6 mar 17
An exclusive guide for starting ES6 in production.
How Rails Sessions Work mar 17
A session is just a place to store data during one request that you can read during later requests.
Left Half and Right Half Layout mar 18
Spliting layouts using different techniques in CSS.
Probably Use initial-scale=1 mar 18
When doing responsive design. Use initial zoom to prevent undesired zooming behavior when device orientation changes.
How to build React apps that load quickly using server side rendering mar 18
Benefits of server-side rendering in react apps.
S.O.L.I.D: The First 5 Principles of Object Oriented Design mar 18
SOLID is an acronym for the first five object-oriented design (OOD) principle by Uncle Bob.
Tail Call Optimization in Ruby mar 18
Ruby actually has support for TCO, but it's not enabled by default.
Make a Mobile App with ReactJS in 30 Minutes mar 19
Reapp s a mobile app platform on React. Here is a small example of how to use it.
Speed Up Rails Asset Pipeline mar 19
Write a custom compressor.
Scrolling Through Large Files mar 19
Navigate through large text files with Ruby.
Understanding Rack Apps and Middleware mar 19
An in-depth look at Rack.
Can We Do Better Than The Click? mar 20
.. by understanding the event cascade.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Ruby on Ales 2015 (14 videos) mar 17
Only first 2 are available yet but it should fill up quickly.
Gorails 47 (23m) mar 20
Multitenancy with the Apartment gem.

item.title: Green Ruby News #110
item.content:encoded:
#110 - mar 15th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
365 Best Websites Around The World 2014
(book) review of one year of awwwards.
Stupid studio
Website of a danish agency.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
USB Typewriter
Yeah this is weird. Love it.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Tunemygc
The default GC configuration is not suitable and optimal for Rails applications. Tune it!
Viewmaster
The layout version switcher for Rails.
Keypress
A Javascript library for capturing keyboard input.
animatedModal.js
jQuery plugin to create a fullscreen modal with CSS3 transitions.
Creative Gooey Effects
A set of example that use a gooey SVG filter for creating a variety of different effects for all kind of website components by Codedrops.
SkyBlue
Minimal CSS Framework.
Afterglow
A minimal dark Theme for Sublime Text.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Vim Config for Rails Ninjas mar 10
Vim owns the Rails community. Deep dive in a configuration setup.
Creating a RubyGems plugin mar 10
This tutorial creates a gem that adds the 'gem repo' command and opens a GitHub repository in your browser.
A Couple of Callback Gotchas (and a Rails 5 Fix) mar 10
A problem to consider due to race condition while using the after_save callback.
Introduction to fetch() mar 10
Make network requests similar to XHR. The fetch API uses Promises, with a simpler and cleaner API.
Understanding CSS Grid Systems from the Ground Up mar 11
CSS grid systems have grown a lot in popularity, quickly becoming considered best practice for rapid layout scaffolding.
Why JavaScript ES6 Arrow Functions Will Make You Happy mar 11
Introduction to Arrow Fuctions in ES6.
Cool Things You Can Do with the PagerDuty API mar 12
For those using Pagerduty, you really should take advantage of their great API.
Properly Setup and Secure a VPN Router mar 12
How to setup a flashed router for a secure VPN.
A Second Look at Alternate Web Frameworks for Ruby mar 12
There are always choice in Ruby, Rails is not the only way to travel.
Schedule Cron Jobs with the Whenever Gem mar 12
There are always choice in Ruby, Rails is not the only way to travel.
Push Notifications on the Open Web mar 12
As of Chrome version 42, Push API and Notification API are available to developers.
Understanding what is Cassandra mar 12
A quick presentation of that NoSQL database.
Write Yourself a Roguelike mar 13
(book) Console game design in ruby.
Add Twitter Authentication to an Ember.js App with Torii mar 13
Torii is a lightweight authentication library for Ember.js. It supports various OAuth providers (such as Twitter, Google or FaceBook).
Creating a Ruby DSL mar 14
Blocks are key to DSLs.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Ember conf 2015 (23 videos) mar 8
All the talks from Ember conf of this year.

item.title: Green Ruby News #109
item.content:encoded:
#109 - mar 8th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Dogstudio
They make good shit (that's what they say).

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Modular Rails
(book) divide your application into small and reusable bricks.
Frontend Stuff
A continuously expanded list of framework/libraries and tools for frontend, mostly js.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.2.1
Some fixes in GC and ffi.
Passenger 5.0.1
The famous Raptor was actually a new passenger.
Airbrush
Airbrussh pretties up your SSHKit and Capistrano output.
Concourse
CI system based on pipelines.
HTTPie
Command line HTTP client, a user-friendly cURL replacement.
Flickity
Touch, responsive, flickable galleries.
Slideout
A touch slideout navigation menu for mobile web apps.
Swiper
Mobile touch slider with hardware accelerated transitions.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Introducing Yesql for Ruby using ROM mar 3
A new adapter for ROM based on the clojure yesql.
Browser Trends March 2015: Renewed Interest in Opera? mar 3
Most recent numbers of browser version usages.
Spicing Up the Bootstrap Carousel with CSS3 Animations mar 3
Bootstrap provides a caroussel plugin, here is how to improve it.
All About Methods mar 3
How methods are defined and bound to instances.
asm.js Speedups Everywhere mar 3
State of how browsers optimizes asm, and where it's going.
Turning the database inside out with apache Samza mar 4
A very long and detailled article in favor of replacing DB by Streams.
Requiring code in Ruby mar 4
Require or require_relative, that is the question.
Blog in Markdown, Deploy with Webhooks mar 4
Thoughtbot evolution of their blog system.
A Guide to Markdown for Simpler Web Writing mar 4
Markdown is widely used in article writing, documentation, help text.
Volt: Assets, Components, and Routes mar 5
Dive inside an example of volt application.
Understanding the CSS animation-fill-mode Property mar 5
That animation-based property isnâ€™t very self-explanatory.
Creating responsive, touch-friendly carousels with Flickity mar 5
Example of usage of Flickity.
Demystifying React Components State mar 6
Components state and when to use them.
Closures in JavaScript mar 7
How the variable names are resolved in nested functions.
Intro to MongoDB for Postgres developers mar 7
Review of what mongodb looks like when you come from postgres.
Rails 4 Performance Tips mar 7
Tricks and tools to make it faster.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Gorail 45 (14m) mar 5
Exporting Records To CSV.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Git Minutes 32 (1h16) mar 2
Adam Spiers on git-deps.
Giant Robots 136 (31m) mar 2
I Think it Was the Altitude (Ben Orenstein).
Developer tea 23 (14m) mar 2
When to Adopt New Technology: A Simple Value-based Rubric.
Web platform #33 (43m) mar 3
React Week.
Ruby5 #532 (5m) mar 3
Secure Cookies, Regex Examples, Debugging Ruby, Arbre. From Rails to Ember, Madison Ruby CFP.
Nodeup 84 (32m) mar 4
io.js update #1.
RubyRogues 197 (1h11) mar 4
The Social Coding Contract with Justin Searls.
Developer tea 24 (23m) mar 4
Scott Jehl on Responsible Responsive Design and Progressive Enhancement, Part One (part 2 was published too, on mar 6th).
Javascript Jabber 149 (43m) mar 4
Passenger Enterprise with Node.js with Hongli Lai and Tinco Andringa.
The Bike Shed 9 (34m) mar 5
Monorails, For the Kids.
Adventure in angular #32 (49m) mar 5
Angular UI Router with Craig McKeachie.
Food Fight Show 89 (52m) mar 5
ChefConf Preview.
Ruby5 #533 (5m) mar 6
Ruby 2.2.1, Regularity, Loading Code with Ruby, Passenger 5.0.1, GORUCO CFP.
The Changelog #145 (1h48) mar 6
10+ Years of Rails with DHH.
Cloudcast 181 (41m) mar 7
Investigating the ELK Stack.

item.title: Green Ruby News #108
item.content:encoded:
#108 - mar 1st 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
USM anniversary initiative
Great layout, and creative navigation.
Coulee creative
Web agency website, very graphical and animated.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.0.0-p643
last ordinal release of Ruby 2.0.0, it's going in security maintenance phase now.
middleman-presentation
Build presentations based on reveal.js.
Fault Tolerant Router
A daemon, running in background on a Linux router or firewall. A real router, not a rails one.
Impress
Presentation tool using CSS3 transform and transitions.
Sharelock
Securely share data.
RancherOS
A minimalist distribution of Linux designed from the ground up to run Docker containers..

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Offline-first, fast, with the sw-precache module feb 23
sw-precache hooks into your existing node-based build process and generates a list of versioned resources.
Dropdown Menus with More Forgiving Mouse Movement Paths feb 23
Old topic but still relevant for multi-level drop down menus.
There's More to Ruby Debugging Than puts() feb 24
Advanced debugging katas.
Why We Killed Off Code Reviews feb 24
How pairing replaced code reviews at RealScout.
Using AngularJS for Data Visualisations feb 25
Run through creating three different sorts of charts using both inline CSS and SVG.
The Beginnerâ€™s Dilemma: Your First 100 Hours of Code feb 26
How to approach the first phase of the learning-to-code journey and a clear path to get you through it.
Using the Sucker Punch Ruby Gem to Cache Stripe Data in Rails feb 26
Even though Stripe is generally pretty fast, retrieving customer data on the fly can be expensive.
The simple but powerful Ruby Struct feb 26
A quick dive into ruby structs.
Service Objects in Rails feb 26
Service Layer to represent a domain-oriented layer of behaviors that provide an API for the domain layer.
Large Scale Payments Systems and Ruby on Rails feb 26
The case of Airbnb for managing payment code.
Fixing Passenger Enterprise + Capistrano zero-downtime restart caveats feb 27
Using Capistrano with Passenger Enterprise's Standalone mode, rolling restarts appear to be broken. Here is how to fix it.
Introduction to Object.observe feb 27
Feature to be added to Javascript of part of ECMAScript 7 to support object change detection natively in the browser.
Basic Curses feb 28
Advanced curses tricks with ffi-ncurses.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Loading Code with Ruby (6m) feb 26
Ruby load path, including how require works, how load works.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
FullStack Radio 10 (1h10) feb 22
Type Safety Roundtable with Ryan Tablada and Matt Machuga.
Giant Robots 135 (33m) feb 23
Planning For Change (Ben Arent).
Web platform #32 (1h06) feb 24
Microsoft Spartan & Internet Explorer.
Ruby5 #530 (5m) feb 24
1.9.3 is dead, HTTP Request in Rails, Melt, Traveler, Merging Ruby Hashes, code outside of Rails, StopLight.
Javascript Jabber 148 (1h05) feb 25
.cx and EveryBit.js with Matt Asher and Dann Toliver.
RubyRogues 196 (1h15) feb 25
Docker with James Turnbull.
Developer tea 21 (25m) feb 25
Why You Should Create a Personal Site and Start Writing.
Adventure in angular #31 (45m) feb 26
Advanced Directives.
Arretsed DevOps 31 (1h06) feb 26
Settings.
Javascript Jabber 150 (1h02) feb 27
OIMs.
Puppetlabs 20150227 (29m) feb 27
Starting and Growing a Puppet User Group.
Ruby5 #531 (6m) feb 27
fast-ruby, middleman-presentation, railyard, ES6 with Rails, Caching with Sucker Punch.
The Changelog #144 (54m) feb 27
GitHub Archive and Changelog Nightly with Ilya Grigorik.

item.title: Green Ruby News #107
item.content:encoded:
#107 - feb 22th 2015

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Genelab
Nice website, but also, well, it's in space.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Remote | OK
An aggregated job board for remote opportunities.
Goal-Oriented Git
(book) another book from Thoughtbot, aimed at git beginners, now in beta.
Commits.io
A shop that sells posters with your github code.
The devops checklist
48 items you can use to gauge the maturity of your software delivery competency.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Redmine 3.0.0
and 2.6.2, including security fixes too.
Rails ERD
Generate Entity-Relationship Diagrams for Rails applications.
Cuba
Cuba is a micro framework in ruby for web applications.
Deployinator
Deploy code like Etsy.
Sonny.js
Minimal single page app framework.
Konva
2d html5 canvas framework for desktop and mobile applications.
Graylog v1.0
A big milestone for that alternative to elk.
Baci
ACI builder for rocket, using Dockerfiles.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Mark Methods Private When You Donâ€™t Test Them feb 16
Mark methods private when you test them indirectly by calling the other, public methods in the same class.
Creating an Image Gallery with the Flickr API feb 16
Tutorial on using the Flickr API.
Building a Credit Card Form Custom Element with Polymer feb 17
Demo of an example usage of polymer.
Breakpoints and Tweakpoints in Sass feb 17
A way to deal with responsive design is to use a map of breakpoints in a config file.
Refactoring code that accesses external services feb 17
Refactor some congealed code into a common pattern: separation of external service access code.
A Brief Look at Alternate Web Frameworks for Ruby feb 17
Because rails is not the only choice.
Using PostgreSQL and jsonb with Ruby on Rails feb 17
PostgreSQL 9.4 introduced jsonb, a new column type for storing documents in your relational database.
Test Drive Your Dockerfiles with RSpec and ServerSpec feb 17
Demonstration on how to TDD a Dockerfile that installs Node on Ubuntu.
Accidental CSS Resets feb 18
Any time you use a shorthand property in CSS, you set all the values for all the properties it deals with.
Gulp on Rails: Replacing the Asset Pipeline feb 18
A solution that fully integrates a Gulp-based asset pipeline with Rails.
Models on a diet feb 18
Usually models are very fat, here is how to extract validations out of the model.
Rails on Docker feb 19
Tutorial to seyup a working rails dev env on a mac.
Understanding Bundler's setup process feb 19
A look into Bundler's code.
The Registry Pattern feb 19
Using a Registry to look up collaborators in Rails, like external APIs.
Some Basic Ruby Tools for Sniffing out Errors feb 20
Quick review of pry, byebug, pry-debug, better_errors, notify_send.
Why doesn't my code work outside of Rails? feb 20
The evil of rails monkey-patching.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Introduction to Importing from CSV (16m) jan 21
Introduction to Importing from CSV.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Developer tea 18 (11m) feb 16
Listener Questions.
NodeUp 83 (1h06) feb 16
A libuv show.
Javascript Jabber 146 (59m) feb 18
io.js with Isaac Schlueter and Mikeal Rogers.
Web platform #31 (51m) feb 17
Building with React.js.
CodePen 36 (31m) feb 18
Settings.
RubyRogues 195 (58m) feb 18
Building Your Technology Radar with Neal Ford.
Adventure in angular #30 (29m) feb 19
Angular Interns with Rodric Haddad and Anting Shen.
Git minutes #31 (1h05) feb 19
Heroku Recommends Puma, pretty_backtrace, Weird Stuff with Hashes, Ruby Survey 2015, Que.
Ruby5 #529 (5m) feb 20
private methods, Set intersection, fat models, Predicting Test Failures.
The cloudcast #179 (40m) feb 20
Managing Containers w/o a Tupperware Party.
Developer tea 19 (14m) feb 20
Ben Orenstein from Thoughtbot, Part One.
The Bike Shed 8 (37m) feb 20
Attributes API, Relation#or, Paid Open Source.
The Changelog #143 (57m) feb 20
Mary Rose Cook on Gitlet.

item.title: Green Ruby News #106
item.content:encoded:
#106 - feb 15th 2015

Look
